If a package uses this will it always be needed at runtime (i.e. it only includes a shared library)? If so you should use [`run_exports`](https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda-build/en/latest/resources/define-metadata.html#export-runtime-requirements):
```suggestion
  skip: True  # [win]
  run_exports:
    - {{ pin_subpackage('xdrfile', max_pin='x.x.x') }}
```
You should adjust `x.x.x` to be your expected ABI stability. (If I compile something downstream against `1.1.4` can I expect the same binaries to work with `1.1.5`? `1.2`? `2.0`?)

@chrisburr thanks for your feedback! About the compatible version, I would conservatively pin to the precise version (`pin_subpackage('xdrfile', min_pin='x.x.x', max_pin='x.x.x')`). I don't think one can find other versions around anyway, and it is not updated since a while. What do you think? Thanks again!
